title: 16.2 Elements of the Greedy Strategy
content:
Section 16.2

Elements of the Greedy Strategy

Summary

When does greedy work? Greedy-choice property and optimal substructure.

Key Points

  • Greedy-choice property: local optimal choice leads to global optimal
  • Optimal substructure: optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
  • Contrast with DP: greedy makes one choice, DP considers all
  • Greedy is usually simpler and faster than DP
  • Must prove greedy-choice property holds!

Example

Activity selection: choosing earliest-finish activity leaves subproblem that also has optimal greedy solution.

Why It Matters

Understanding when greedy works vs when you need DP.
